discussion.content: A UPS not only provides surge protection, but also a back-up battery to provide power during an outage.

questions.question_text:
A user is requesting a solution that will prevent file corruption and ensure a graceful shutdown while providing at least one hour of uptime in case of extreme weather conditions.
Which of the following should a technician recommend?

choices.A: Verify the browser's proxy configuration settings
choices.D: Scan the user's workstation for malware
choices.B: Instruct the user to use the alternate web browser instead
choices.E: Disconnect and reconnect from the corporate VPN

discussion.content:
After connecting to the corporate VPN, a user’s workstation is no longer able to browse Internet websites. However, when the technician launches a different web browser on the same computer, it successfully reaches the website. What should the technician do next?
1. Verify the browser’s proxy configuration settings
2. Instruct the user to use the alternate web browser instead
3. Flush the workstation’s DNS cache
4. Scan the user’s workstation for malware
5. Disconnect and reconnect from the corporate VPN
The most appropriate action depends on the specific situation, but starting with verifying the proxy settings or instructing the user to use the alternate browser would be a good initial step.

comments.content: IDK, what second step your referring to, but if its problem with "1" browser then its probably the PROXY but if its all the browsers then its either CERTIFICATS or HOST FILES.

discussion.content:
What would be the second step?

questions.question_text: After connecting to the corporate VPN, a user's workstation is no longer to browse Internet websites. A technician discovers launching a different web browser on the same computer reaches the websites correctly. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?
A user is unable to open a document on a shared drive from a Linux workstation. Which of the following commands would help the user gain access to the document?

discussion.content: What does grep do in Linux environment?

comments.content: grep is a command-line utility for searching plain-text data sets for lines that match a regular expression, CHMOD is the answer here cause you can connect to the network so you dont need IPCONFIG or NETSTAT

discussion.content: Chmod - used to change file permissions on UNIX OP systems (Linux in this case)

questions.question_text: A customer is shopping for a new tablet. The customer is primarily concerned about transferring applications from the old tablet to the new one. Which of the following specifications is MOST important when selecting a new tablet?

discussion.content: I thought B as well at first, but then I noticed transferring apps. Though storage plays a roll, storage means poo if you use a software that isn't supported by the receiving OS.

Selected Answer: D
The user wants to transfer all the applications. On a different operating system is not sure all the applications are available. So D makes sense.

Selected Answer: D
Operating system is the right answer as we're only talking about applications and compatibility is the first thing when it comes to apps. If it was saying pictures and videos, then Storage is the right one
I say D is correct because of compatibility and apps could be stored online. That's my thought process on choosing D as my answer.

Selected Answer: D
definitely OS, have to make sure the app is compatible when switching from IOS to android or the other way around

Selected Answer: B
I would go with B. Storage, the user wants to make sure all the applications can be transferred into the new tablet. Apps need storage space.

The answer is D. 
The idea here is to migrate your applications from your old tablet to a new tablet. You can't migrate your old iOS apps to an Android tablet and vice versa. The concern should be what operating system the new tablet is running.

comments.content: I meant supported by the OS

discussion.content: I think Operating System makes sense since some of the applications that are available in MAC does not necessarily available on Android, and vice versa

comments.content: I originally thought storage. But OS is the correct answer. If a customer came in with an ipad and wanted to transfer applications, you wouldnt recommend an android

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
why the OS ?
he could have everything in the cloud, he needs to meet the storage that he has on the other part and have higher storage

questions.question_text: A technician needs to ensure users are prompted or warned when an installation takes place on a Windows system. Which of the following would meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
UAC - User Account Control (IMO, Remember that shield Icon that notifies you if you want to continue an Installation, that is a UAC feature)

To ensure that users are prompted or warned during installations on a Windows system, the most suitable approach is to enable User Account Control (UAC). UAC is a built-in Windows feature that helps prevent unauthorized changes to the system. When an installation or other potentially risky action occurs, UAC displays a permissions dialogue box, notifying the user and seeking their confirmation before proceeding.

Therefore, the correct answer is:
C. Enable UAC on the workstation.

Remember that familiar shield icon that pops up when you’re about to install something? That’s the UAC feature in action!

UAC (User Account Control)   Windows feature implemented to stop unauthorized changes to Windows. UAC enables standard accounts to do common tasks and provides a permissions dialog box when standard and administrator accounts do certain things that could potentially harm the computer (such as attempt to install a program).
- Mike Meyers ebook
